title: Font Improvements in Windows 7
content:
This may be old news to some of you, but there's some [new font improvements](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109011254/http:/www.istartedsomething.com/20081030/improvements-to-fonts-in-windows-7/) in the works for Windows 7. Perhaps the best new feature is the ability to turn fonts on and off within the OS itself (no third party software needed).

The site linked above also has some screenshots of [Gabriola](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109011254/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/font.aspx?FMID=1741), a new script font for Windows. It says it has OpenType, so maybe that means MS Office will finally be able to take advantage those features. Can anyone confirm this?
author: Peter G.

comments.content: If its true then this is some very needed updates to windows! I am totally pumed for W7!
